intro: Hieracium fuscum var. apricum, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, featuring lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. Its flowers are bright yellow, arranged in a cluster, and bloom from late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, pastures, and along roadsides.
